Blaustein, Jakob, U.S., business executive; b. Baltimore, Md., Sept. 30, 1892; s. Louis and Henrietta )Gittelsohn( ; m. Hilda Van Leer Katz, June 20, 1925. Dir., member, exec. comm.; 1910Amer. Oil Co., co-founder with father, )merged with Pan. Amer. Petroleum and
Transport Co., 1933(, pres., 1933-37; Mexican Petroleum Corp., Me., pres., 1933-37; Pan Amer. Petroleum and Transport Co.; Pan Amer. Refining Corp. ; Pan Amer. Pipe Line Co.; Pan Amer. Production Co.; Mexican Petroleum Corp., Ga.; Pan Amer. Gas Co.; Lord Baltimore Filling Stations, Inc.; pres. and dir., Amer. Trading and Production Corp.; dir., advisory comm. : Union Trust Co., Md.; U.S. Fidelity and Guaranty Co.; former pres., Overseas News Agency. Consultant, Amer. delegation, UN Conf., S.F., 1945; chmn, Amer. ;1946delegation, Conf. of Jewish Orgs., London, chmn, AJ Comm. Deleg., Paris Peace Conf., 1949; 2 missions to Israel at request of Prime Minister; co-chmn, Consultative Council of Jewish Orgs. to Economic and Social Council, UN; dir.: Asso. Jewish Charities, Baltimore )former pres.(; JDC; United Service for New Americans; Amer. Financial and Development Corp. for Israel; Amer. Fund for Israel Oorgs.; Amer. Assn for UN; Natl Conf. of Christians and Jews; Weizmann Inst. of Science; CJFWF; Baltimore Symphony Orchestra; member: bd of govs, Hebrew U. of Jerusalem; bd of trustees, Harry S. Truman Library; pres., AJComm; Louis and Henrietta Blaustein Found., Inc.; member, Pres. Truman's Natl Advisory Bd on Mobilization Policy; acting chmn, marketing comm., member, supplies and distribution comm. and joint use facilities comm., U.S.
Petroleum Administration for War, World War II; member, natl petroleum council, oil and gas div., U.S. Dept. of Interior; vicechmn, Natl Citizens Comm. for UN Day; vice-pres., Jewish Restitution Successor Org.; member, presidium, Conf. on Jewish Material Claims against Germany. Clubs: Phoenix and Suburban, Baltimore. (מתוך הספר 1955/56World Jewish Register )
